summary: Feature request to implement a configurable timeout for workflow activation to prevent workers from becoming unresponsive when workflows enter infinite loops. This would limit CPU usage and thread pool occupation caused by stuck workflows.
userImpact: Workers can become unresponsive and consume excessive CPU when workflows get stuck in infinite loops, impacting application stability.
rootCause: Workflows without execution time limits can run indefinitely, blocking worker threads and consuming resources.
proposedFix: Use a configurable timeout parameter (similar to isolated-vm's timeout option) to limit workflow activation time.
resolutionDetails: Implemented configurable workflow activation timeout to prevent unresponsive workers from stuck workflows.
keyQuote: Use a configurable timeout to limit the WF activation time.
